# Auth UI Slicing - AI Implementation Plan

<!-- Generated by AI and reviewed by human -->

## Overview

Create a responsive login screen with platform-adaptive layouts:
- **Mobile**: Single column, image at top (portrait crop), stacked form below
- **Web**: Two-column layout, form left, image right (landscape)

Use `login_screen.dart` as entry point that delegates to platform-specific widgets.

## Implementation Steps

1. **Verify asset configuration**
   - Ensure `assets/images/login.jpg` is declared in `pubspec.yaml`

2. **Create shared login form widget**
   - `widgets/login_form.dart` - reusable form containing:
     - Email TextField
     - Password TextField with obscure toggle
     - "Sign in" button
     - "Sign up" link
   - Accept callbacks for onSignIn, onSignUp

3. **Create mobile-specific screen**
   - `widgets/mobile/login_screen_mobile.dart`
   - Layout: Column with SingleChildScrollView
     - Image (portrait crop, ~40% height)
     - Padding with LoginForm
     - Footer "© 2025 ALL RIGHTS RESERVED"

4. **Create web-specific screen**
   - `widgets/web/login_screen_web.dart`
   - Layout: Row with two Expanded children
     - Left: Centered LoginForm (max-width constrained ~400px)
     - Right: Image (cover fit, landscape)
   - Responsive: collapse to single column on narrow screens (<800px)
   - Footer centered at bottom

5. **Create main login screen**
   - `screens/login_screen.dart`
   - Use `kIsWeb` or `LayoutBuilder` to choose between mobile/web widget
   - No business logic, UI only

## Files to Create/Modify

| File                                                   | Action | Description                                    |
|--------------------------------------------------------|--------|------------------------------------------------|
| `pubspec.yaml`                                         | Modify | Add assets/images/ to assets section           |
| `presentation/widgets/login_form.dart`                 | Create | Shared form widget with all inputs and buttons |
| `presentation/widgets/mobile/login_screen_mobile.dart` | Create | Mobile layout (image top, form below)          |
| `presentation/widgets/web/login_screen_web.dart`       | Create | Web layout (form left, image right)            |
| `presentation/screens/login_screen.dart`               | Create | Entry point, delegates to mobile/web           |

## UI Components Breakdown

### Text Content
- Title: Your Next Ride Starts Here
- Subtitle: Explore, rent, or buy Electrum bikes and hit the road fully charged.
- Footer: © 2025 ALL RIGHTS RESERVED

### Form Fields
- Email: label "Email", hint "Example@email.com"
- Password: label "Password", hint "At least 5 characters"

### Buttons
- Primary: "Sign in" (dark background, white text, rounded)

### Links
- "Don't you have an account? Sign up" (Sign up is blue link)

## Dependencies

No additional packages required for UI-only implementation. Uses:
- `flutter/material.dart`
- `flutter/foundation.dart` (for `kIsWeb`)

## Design Tokens

Use theme colors from `main.dart` via `Theme.of(context).colorScheme`:

```dart
// Access in widgets:
final colorScheme = Theme.of(context).colorScheme;

// Available colors:
colorScheme.primary      // 0xFF043915 - Dark green (Sign in button)
colorScheme.secondary    // 0xFFFFFD8F - Light yellow
colorScheme.onPrimary    // Text on primary button
colorScheme.outline      // Input borders
```

No hardcoded colors - use theme consistently.

## Testing Strategy

- manual by user

## Notes

- UI only - all button callbacks will be empty/print statements
- User will wire to main.dart manually
- Routing with go_router comes in separate task
